105/*
106 * The maximum number of stack frames to dump on assertion failure.
107 */
108#ifndef BACKTRACE_MAXFRAME
109#define BACKTRACE_MAXFRAME 128
110#endif
111
112LIBISC_EXTERNAL_DATA extern int isc_dscp_check_value;
113LIBDNS_EXTERNAL_DATA extern unsigned int dns_zone_mkey_hour;
114LIBDNS_EXTERNAL_DATA extern unsigned int dns_zone_mkey_day;
115LIBDNS_EXTERNAL_DATA extern unsigned int dns_zone_mkey_month;

118static char program_name[NAME_MAX] = "named";

120static char saved_command_line[512];
121static char version[512];
122static unsigned int maxsocks = 0;
123static int maxudp = 0;

131static bool ednsnotimp = false;

143 * -4 and -6

145static bool disable6 = false;
146static bool disable4 = false;
147
148void
149named_main_earlywarning(const char *format, ...) {
150 va_list args;
151
152 va_start(args, format);
153 if (named_g_lctx != NULL) {
154 isc_log_vwrite(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
155 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_WARNING,
156 format, args);
157 } else {
158 fprintf(stderr, "%s: ", program_name);
159 vfprintf(stderr, format, args);
160 fprintf(stderr, "\n");
161 fflush(stderr);
162 }
163 va_end(args);
164}
165
166void
167named_main_earlyfatal(const char *format, ...) {
168 va_list args;
169
170 va_start(args, format);
171 if (named_g_lctx != NULL) {
172 isc_log_vwrite(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
173 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_CRITICAL,
174 format, args);
175 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
176 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_CRITICAL,
177 "exiting (due to early fatal error)");
178 } else {
179 fprintf(stderr, "%s: ", program_name);
180 vfprintf(stderr, format, args);
181 fprintf(stderr, "\n");
182 fflush(stderr);
183 }
184 va_end(args);
185
186 exit(1);
187}
188
189ISC_PLATFORM_NORETURN_PRE static void
190assertion_failed(const char *file, int line, isc_assertiontype_t type,
191 const char *cond) ISC_PLATFORM_NORETURN_POST;
192
193static void
194assertion_failed(const char *file, int line, isc_assertiontype_t type,
195 const char *cond)
196{
197 void *tracebuf[BACKTRACE_MAXFRAME];
198 int i, nframes;
199 isc_result_t result;
200 const char *logsuffix = "";
201 const char *fname;
202
203 /*
204 * Handle assertion failures.
205 */
206
207 if (named_g_lctx != NULL) {
208 /*
209 * Reset the assertion callback in case it is the log
210 * routines causing the assertion.
211 */
212 isc_assertion_setcallback(NULL);
213
214 result = isc_backtrace_gettrace(tracebuf, BACKTRACE_MAXFRAME,
215 &nframes);
216 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS && nframes > 0)
217 logsuffix = ", back trace";
218 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
219 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_CRITICAL,
220 "%s:%d: %s(%s) failed%s", file, line,
221 isc_assertion_typetotext(type), cond, logsuffix);
222 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
223 for (i = 0; i < nframes; i++) {
224 unsigned long offset;
225
226 fname = NULL;
227 result = isc_backtrace_getsymbol(tracebuf[i],
228 &fname,
229 &offset);
230 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
231 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx,
232 NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
233 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN,
234 ISC_LOG_CRITICAL,
235 "#%d %p in %s()+0x%lx", i,
236 tracebuf[i], fname,
237 offset);
238 } else {
239 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx,
240 NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
241 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN,
242 ISC_LOG_CRITICAL,
243 "#%d %p in ??", i,
244 tracebuf[i]);
245 }
246 }
247 }
248 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
249 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_CRITICAL,
250 "exiting (due to assertion failure)");
251 } else {
252 fprintf(stderr, "%s:%d: %s(%s) failed\n",
253 file, line, isc_assertion_typetotext(type), cond);
254 fflush(stderr);
255 }
256
257 if (named_g_coreok)
258 abort();
259 exit(1);
260}
261
262ISC_PLATFORM_NORETURN_PRE static void
263library_fatal_error(const char *file, int line, const char *format,
264 va_list args)
265ISC_FORMAT_PRINTF(3, 0) ISC_PLATFORM_NORETURN_POST;
266
267static void
268library_fatal_error(const char *file, int line, const char *format,
269 va_list args)
270{
271 /*
272 * Handle isc_error_fatal() calls from our libraries.
273 */
274
275 if (named_g_lctx != NULL) {
276 /*
277 * Reset the error callback in case it is the log
278 * routines causing the assertion.
279 */
280 isc_error_setfatal(NULL);
281
282 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
283 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_CRITICAL,
284 "%s:%d: fatal error:", file, line);
285 isc_log_vwrite(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
286 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_CRITICAL,
287 format, args);
288 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
289 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_CRITICAL,
290 "exiting (due to fatal error in library)");
291 } else {
292 fprintf(stderr, "%s:%d: fatal error: ", file, line);
293 vfprintf(stderr, format, args);
294 fprintf(stderr, "\n");
295 fflush(stderr);
296 }
297
298 if (named_g_coreok)
299 abort();
300 exit(1);
301}
302
303static void
304library_unexpected_error(const char *file, int line, const char *format,
305 va_list args) ISC_FORMAT_PRINTF(3, 0);
306
307static void
308library_unexpected_error(const char *file, int line, const char *format,
309 va_list args)
310{
311 /*
312 * Handle isc_error_unexpected() calls from our libraries.
313 */
314
315 if (named_g_lctx != NULL) {
316 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
317 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_ERROR,
318 "%s:%d: unexpected error:", file, line);
319 isc_log_vwrite(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
320 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_ERROR,
321 format, args);
322 } else {
323 fprintf(stderr, "%s:%d: fatal error: ", file, line);
324 vfprintf(stderr, format, args);
325 fprintf(stderr, "\n");
326 fflush(stderr);
327 }
328}
329
330static void
331usage(void) {
332 fprintf(stderr,
333 "usage: named [-4|-6] [-c conffile] [-d debuglevel] "
334 "[-E engine] [-f|-g]\n"
335 " [-n number_of_cpus] [-p port] [-s] "
336 "[-S sockets] [-t chrootdir]\n"
337 " [-u username] [-U listeners] "
338 "[-m {usage|trace|record|size|mctx}]\n"
339 "usage: named [-v|-V]\n");
340}
341
342static void
343save_command_line(int argc, char *argv[]) {
344 int i;
345 char *src;
346 char *dst;
347 char *eob;
348 const char truncated[] = "...";
349 bool quoted = false;
350
351 dst = saved_command_line;
352 eob = saved_command_line + sizeof(saved_command_line);
353
354 for (i = 1; i < argc && dst < eob; i++) {
355 *dst++ = ' ';
356
357 src = argv[i];
358 while (*src != '\0' && dst < eob) {
359 /*
360 * This won't perfectly produce a shell-independent
361 * pastable command line in all circumstances, but
362 * comes close, and for practical purposes will
363 * nearly always be fine.
364 */
365 if (quoted || isalnum(*src & 0xff) ||
366 *src == '-' || *src == '_' ||
367 *src == '.' || *src == '/') {
368 *dst++ = *src++;
369 quoted = false;
370 } else {
371 *dst++ = '\\';
372 quoted = true;
373 }
374 }
375 }
376
377 INSIST(sizeof(saved_command_line) >= sizeof(truncated));
378
379 if (dst == eob)
380 strcpy(eob - sizeof(truncated), truncated);
381 else
382 *dst = '\0';
383}
384
385static int
386parse_int(char *arg, const char *desc) {
387 char *endp;
388 int tmp;
389 long int ltmp;
390
391 ltmp = strtol(arg, &endp, 10);
392 tmp = (int) ltmp;
393 if (*endp != '\0')
394 named_main_earlyfatal("%s '%s' must be numeric", desc, arg);
395 if (tmp < 0 || tmp != ltmp)
396 named_main_earlyfatal("%s '%s' out of range", desc, arg);
397 return (tmp);
398}
399
400static struct flag_def {
401 const char *name;
402 unsigned int value;
403 bool negate;
404} mem_debug_flags[] = {
405 { "none", 0, false },
406 { "trace", ISC_MEM_DEBUGTRACE, false },
407 { "record", ISC_MEM_DEBUGRECORD, false },
408 { "usage", ISC_MEM_DEBUGUSAGE, false },
409 { "size", ISC_MEM_DEBUGSIZE, false },
410 { "mctx", ISC_MEM_DEBUGCTX, false },
411 { NULL, 0, false }
412}, mem_context_flags[] = {
413 { "external", ISC_MEMFLAG_INTERNAL, true },
414 { "fill", ISC_MEMFLAG_FILL, false },
415 { "nofill", ISC_MEMFLAG_FILL, true },
416 { NULL, 0, false }
417};
418
419static void
420set_flags(const char *arg, struct flag_def *defs, unsigned int *ret) {
421 bool clear = false;
422
423 for (;;) {
424 const struct flag_def *def;
425 const char *end = strchr(arg, ',');
426 int arglen;
427 if (end == NULL)
428 end = arg + strlen(arg);
429 arglen = (int)(end - arg);
430 for (def = defs; def->name != NULL; def++) {
431 if (arglen == (int)strlen(def->name) &&
432 memcmp(arg, def->name, arglen) == 0) {
433 if (def->value == 0)
434 clear = true;
435 if (def->negate)
436 *ret &= ~(def->value);
437 else
438 *ret |= def->value;
439 goto found;
440 }
441 }
442 named_main_earlyfatal("unrecognized flag '%.*s'", arglen, arg);
443 found:
444 if (clear || (*end == '\0'))
445 break;
446 arg = end + 1;
447 }
448
449 if (clear)
450 *ret = 0;
451}
452
453static void
454printversion(bool verbose) {
455 char rndcconf[PATH_MAX], *dot = NULL;
456
457 printf("%s %s%s%s <id:%s>\n",
458 named_g_product, named_g_version,
459 (*named_g_description != '\0') ? " " : "",
460 named_g_description, named_g_srcid);
461
462 if (!verbose) {
463 return;
464 }
465
466 printf("running on %s\n", named_os_uname());
467 printf("built by %s with %s\n",
468 named_g_builder, named_g_configargs);
469#ifdef __clang__
470 printf("compiled by CLANG %s\n", __VERSION__);
471#else
472#if defined(__ICC) || defined(__INTEL_COMPILER)
473 printf("compiled by ICC %s\n", __VERSION__);
474#else
475#ifdef __GNUC__
476 printf("compiled by GCC %s\n", __VERSION__);
477#endif
478#endif
479#endif
480#ifdef _MSC_VER
481 printf("compiled by MSVC %d\n", _MSC_VER);
482#endif
483#ifdef __SUNPRO_C
484 printf("compiled by Solaris Studio %x\n", __SUNPRO_C);
485#endif
486 printf("compiled with OpenSSL version: %s\n",
487 OPENSSL_VERSION_TEXT);
488#if !defined(LIBRESSL_VERSION_NUMBER) && \
489OPENSSL_VERSION_NUMBER >= 0x10100000L /* 1.1.0 or higher */
490 printf("linked to OpenSSL version: %s\n",
491 OpenSSL_version(OPENSSL_VERSION));
492
493#else
494 printf("linked to OpenSSL version: %s\n",
495 SSLeay_version(SSLEAY_VERSION));
496#endif /* OPENSSL_VERSION_NUMBER >= 0x10100000L */
497#ifdef HAVE_LIBXML2
498 printf("compiled with libxml2 version: %s\n",
499 LIBXML_DOTTED_VERSION);
500 printf("linked to libxml2 version: %s\n",
501 xmlParserVersion);
502#endif
503#if defined(HAVE_JSON) && defined(JSON_C_VERSION)
504 printf("compiled with libjson-c version: %s\n",
505 JSON_C_VERSION);
506 printf("linked to libjson-c version: %s\n",
507 json_c_version());
508#endif
509#if defined(HAVE_ZLIB) && defined(ZLIB_VERSION)
510 printf("compiled with zlib version: %s\n",
511 ZLIB_VERSION);
512 printf("linked to zlib version: %s\n",
513 zlibVersion());
514#endif
515 printf("threads support is enabled\n\n");
516
517
518 /*
519 * The default rndc.conf and rndc.key paths are in the same
520 * directory, but named only has rndc.key defined internally.
521 * We construct the rndc.conf path from it. (We could use
522 * NAMED_SYSCONFDIR here but the result would look wrong on
523 * Windows.)
524 */
525 strlcpy(rndcconf, named_g_keyfile, sizeof(rndcconf));
526 dot = strrchr(rndcconf, '.');
527 if (dot != NULL) {
528 size_t len = dot - rndcconf + 1;
529 snprintf(dot + 1, PATH_MAX - len, "conf");
530 }
531
532 /*
533 * Print default configuration paths.
534 */
535 printf("default paths:\n");
536 printf(" named configuration: %s\n", named_g_conffile);
537 printf(" rndc configuration: %s\n", rndcconf);
538 printf(" DNSSEC root key: %s\n", named_g_defaultbindkeys);
539 printf(" nsupdate session key: %s\n", named_g_defaultsessionkeyfile);
540 printf(" named PID file: %s\n", named_g_defaultpidfile);
541 printf(" named lock file: %s\n", named_g_defaultlockfile);
542
543}
544
545static void
546parse_fuzz_arg(void) {
547 if (!strncmp(isc_commandline_argument, "client:", 7)) {
548 named_g_fuzz_addr = isc_commandline_argument + 7;
549 named_g_fuzz_type = isc_fuzz_client;
550 } else if (!strncmp(isc_commandline_argument, "tcp:", 4)) {
551 named_g_fuzz_addr = isc_commandline_argument + 4;
552 named_g_fuzz_type = isc_fuzz_tcpclient;
553 } else if (!strncmp(isc_commandline_argument, "resolver:", 9)) {
554 named_g_fuzz_addr = isc_commandline_argument + 9;
555 named_g_fuzz_type = isc_fuzz_resolver;
556 } else if (!strncmp(isc_commandline_argument, "http:", 5)) {
557 named_g_fuzz_addr = isc_commandline_argument + 5;
558 named_g_fuzz_type = isc_fuzz_http;
559 } else if (!strncmp(isc_commandline_argument, "rndc:", 5)) {
560 named_g_fuzz_addr = isc_commandline_argument + 5;
561 named_g_fuzz_type = isc_fuzz_rndc;
562 } else {
563 named_main_earlyfatal("unknown fuzzing type '%s'",
564 isc_commandline_argument);
565 }
566}
567
568static void
569parse_T_opt(char *option) {
570 const char *p;
571 char *last = NULL;
572 /*
573 * force the server to behave (or misbehave) in
574 * specified ways for testing purposes.
575 *
576 * clienttest: make clients single shot with their
577 * own memory context.
578 * delay=xxxx: delay client responses by xxxx ms to
579 * simulate remote servers.
580 * dscp=x: check that dscp values are as
581 * expected and assert otherwise.
582 */
583 if (!strcmp(option, "clienttest")) {
584 clienttest = true;
585 } else if (!strncmp(option, "delay=", 6)) {
586 delay = atoi(option + 6);
587 } else if (!strcmp(option, "dropedns")) {
588 dropedns = true;
589 } else if (!strncmp(option, "dscp=", 5)) {
590 isc_dscp_check_value = atoi(option + 5);
591 } else if (!strcmp(option, "ednsformerr")) {
592 ednsformerr = true;
593 } else if (!strcmp(option, "ednsnotimp")) {
594 ednsnotimp = true;
595 } else if (!strcmp(option, "ednsrefused")) {
596 ednsrefused = true;
597 } else if (!strcmp(option, "fixedlocal")) {
598 fixedlocal = true;
599 } else if (!strcmp(option, "keepstderr")) {
600 named_g_keepstderr = true;
601 } else if (!strcmp(option, "noaa")) {
602 noaa = true;
603 } else if (!strcmp(option, "noedns")) {
604 noedns = true;
605 } else if (!strcmp(option, "nonearest")) {
606 nonearest = true;
607 } else if (!strcmp(option, "nosoa")) {
608 nosoa = true;
609 } else if (!strcmp(option, "nosyslog")) {
610 named_g_nosyslog = true;
611 } else if (!strcmp(option, "notcp")) {
612 notcp = true;
613 } else if (!strcmp(option, "maxudp512")) {
614 maxudp = 512;
615 } else if (!strcmp(option, "maxudp1460")) {
616 maxudp = 1460;
617 } else if (!strncmp(option, "maxudp=", 7)) {
618 maxudp = atoi(option + 7);
619 } else if (!strncmp(option, "mkeytimers=", 11)) {
620 p = strtok_r(option + 11, "/", &last);
621 if (p == NULL) {
622 named_main_earlyfatal("bad mkeytimer");
623 }
624
625 dns_zone_mkey_hour = atoi(p);
626 if (dns_zone_mkey_hour == 0) {
627 named_main_earlyfatal("bad mkeytimer");
628 }
629
630 p = strtok_r(NULL, "/", &last);
631 if (p == NULL) {
632 dns_zone_mkey_day = (24 * dns_zone_mkey_hour);
633 dns_zone_mkey_month = (30 * dns_zone_mkey_day);
634 return;
635 }
636
637 dns_zone_mkey_day = atoi(p);
638 if (dns_zone_mkey_day < dns_zone_mkey_hour)
639 named_main_earlyfatal("bad mkeytimer");
640
641 p = strtok_r(NULL, "/", &last);
642 if (p == NULL) {
643 dns_zone_mkey_month = (30 * dns_zone_mkey_day);
644 return;
645 }
646
647 dns_zone_mkey_month = atoi(p);
648 if (dns_zone_mkey_month < dns_zone_mkey_day) {
649 named_main_earlyfatal("bad mkeytimer");
650 }
651 } else if (!strcmp(option, "sigvalinsecs")) {
652 sigvalinsecs = true;
653 } else if (!strncmp(option, "tat=", 4)) {
654 named_g_tat_interval = atoi(option + 4);
655 } else {
656 fprintf(stderr, "unknown -T flag '%s'\n", option);
657 }
658}
659
660static void
661parse_command_line(int argc, char *argv[]) {
662 int ch;
663 int port;
664 const char *p;
665
666 save_command_line(argc, argv);
667
668 /*
669 * NAMED_MAIN_ARGS is defined in main.h, so that it can be used
670 * both by named and by ntservice hooks.
671 */
672 isc_commandline_errprint = false;
673 while ((ch = isc_commandline_parse(argc, argv,
674 NAMED_MAIN_ARGS)) != -1)
675 {
676 switch (ch) {
677 case '4':
678 if (disable4)
679 named_main_earlyfatal("cannot specify "
680 "-4 and -6");
681 if (isc_net_probeipv4() != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
682 named_main_earlyfatal("IPv4 not supported "
683 "by OS");
684 isc_net_disableipv6();
685 disable6 = true;
686 break;
687 case '6':
688 if (disable6)
689 named_main_earlyfatal("cannot specify "
690 "-4 and -6");
691 if (isc_net_probeipv6() != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
692 named_main_earlyfatal("IPv6 not supported "
693 "by OS");
694 isc_net_disableipv4();
695 disable4 = true;
696 break;
697 case 'A':
698 parse_fuzz_arg();
699 break;
700 case 'c':
701 named_g_conffile = isc_commandline_argument;
702 named_g_conffileset = true;
703 break;
704 case 'd':
705 named_g_debuglevel = parse_int(isc_commandline_argument,
706 "debug level");
707 break;
708 case 'D':
709 /* Descriptive comment for 'ps'. */
710 break;
711 case 'E':
712 named_g_engine = isc_commandline_argument;
713 break;
714 case 'f':
715 named_g_foreground = true;
716 break;
717 case 'g':
718 named_g_foreground = true;
719 named_g_logstderr = true;
720 break;
721 case 'L':
722 named_g_logfile = isc_commandline_argument;
723 break;
724 case 'M':
725 set_flags(isc_commandline_argument, mem_context_flags,
726 &isc_mem_defaultflags);
727 break;
728 case 'm':
729 set_flags(isc_commandline_argument, mem_debug_flags,
730 &isc_mem_debugging);
731 break;
732 case 'N': /* Deprecated. */
733 case 'n':
734 named_g_cpus = parse_int(isc_commandline_argument,
735 "number of cpus");
736 if (named_g_cpus == 0)
737 named_g_cpus = 1;
738 break;
739 case 'p':
740 port = parse_int(isc_commandline_argument, "port");
741 if (port < 1 || port > 65535)
742 named_main_earlyfatal("port '%s' out of range",
743 isc_commandline_argument);
744 named_g_port = port;
745 break;
746 case 's':
747 /* XXXRTH temporary syntax */
748 want_stats = true;
749 break;
750 case 'S':
751 maxsocks = parse_int(isc_commandline_argument,
752 "max number of sockets");
753 break;
754 case 't':
755 /* XXXJAB should we make a copy? */
756 named_g_chrootdir = isc_commandline_argument;
757 break;
758 case 'T': /* NOT DOCUMENTED */
759 parse_T_opt(isc_commandline_argument);
760 break;
761 case 'U':
762 named_g_udpdisp = parse_int(isc_commandline_argument,
763 "number of UDP listeners "
764 "per interface");
765 break;
766 case 'u':
767 named_g_username = isc_commandline_argument;
768 break;
769 case 'v':
770 printversion(false);
771 exit(0);
772 case 'V':
773 printversion(true);
774 exit(0);
775 case 'x':
776 /* Obsolete. No longer in use. Ignore. */
777 break;
778 case 'X':
779 named_g_forcelock = true;
780 if (strcasecmp(isc_commandline_argument, "none") != 0)
781 named_g_defaultlockfile =
782 isc_commandline_argument;
783 else
784 named_g_defaultlockfile = NULL;
785 break;
786 case 'F':
787 /* Reserved for FIPS mode */
788 /* FALLTHROUGH */
789 case '?':
790 usage();
791 if (isc_commandline_option == '?')
792 exit(0);
793 p = strchr(NAMED_MAIN_ARGS, isc_commandline_option);
794 if (p == NULL || *++p != ':')
795 named_main_earlyfatal("unknown option '-%c'",
796 isc_commandline_option);
797 else
798 named_main_earlyfatal("option '-%c' requires "
799 "an argument",
800 isc_commandline_option);
801 /* FALLTHROUGH */
802 default:
803 named_main_earlyfatal("parsing options returned %d",
804 ch);
805 }
806 }
807
808 argc -= isc_commandline_index;
809 argv += isc_commandline_index;
810 POST(argv);
811
812 if (argc > 0) {
813 usage();
814 named_main_earlyfatal("extra command line arguments");
815 }
816}
817
818static isc_result_t
819create_managers(void) {
820 isc_result_t result;
821 unsigned int socks;
822
823 INSIST(named_g_cpus_detected > 0);
824
825 if (named_g_cpus == 0)
826 named_g_cpus = named_g_cpus_detected;
827 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
828 NAMED_LOGMODULE_SERVER, ISC_LOG_INFO,
829 "found %u CPU%s, using %u worker thread%s",
830 named_g_cpus_detected,
831 named_g_cpus_detected == 1 ? "" : "s",
832 named_g_cpus, named_g_cpus == 1 ? "" : "s");
833#ifdef WIN32
834 named_g_udpdisp = 1;
835#else
836 if (named_g_udpdisp == 0) {
837 named_g_udpdisp = named_g_cpus_detected;
838 }
839 if (named_g_udpdisp > named_g_cpus)
840 named_g_udpdisp = named_g_cpus;
841#endif
842 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
843 NAMED_LOGMODULE_SERVER, ISC_LOG_INFO,
844 "using %u UDP listener%s per interface",
845 named_g_udpdisp, named_g_udpdisp == 1 ? "" : "s");
846
847 result = isc_taskmgr_create(named_g_mctx, named_g_cpus, 0,
848 &named_g_taskmgr);
849 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
850 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
851 "isc_taskmgr_create() failed: %s",
852 isc_result_totext(result));
853 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
854 }
855
856 result = isc_timermgr_create(named_g_mctx, &named_g_timermgr);
857 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
858 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
859 "isc_timermgr_create() failed: %s",
860 isc_result_totext(result));
861 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
862 }
863
864 result = isc_socketmgr_create2(named_g_mctx, &named_g_socketmgr,
865 maxsocks, named_g_cpus);
866 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
867 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
868 "isc_socketmgr_create() failed: %s",
869 isc_result_totext(result));
870 return (ISC_R_UNEXPECTED);
871 }
872 isc_socketmgr_maxudp(named_g_socketmgr, maxudp);
873 result = isc_socketmgr_getmaxsockets(named_g_socketmgr, &socks);
874 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
875 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
876 NAMED_LOGMODULE_SERVER,
877 ISC_LOG_INFO, "using up to %u sockets", socks);
878 }
879
880 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
881}
882
883static void
884destroy_managers(void) {
885 /*
886 * isc_taskmgr_destroy() will block until all tasks have exited,
887 */
888 isc_taskmgr_destroy(&named_g_taskmgr);
889 isc_timermgr_destroy(&named_g_timermgr);
890 isc_socketmgr_destroy(&named_g_socketmgr);
891}
892
893static void
894dump_symboltable(void) {
895 int i;
896 isc_result_t result;
897 const char *fname;
898 const void *addr;
899
900 if (isc__backtrace_nsymbols == 0)
901 return;
902
903 if (!isc_log_wouldlog(named_g_lctx, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(99)))
904 return;
905
906 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
907 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(99),
908 "Symbol table:");
909
910 for (i = 0, result = ISC_R_SUCCESS; result == ISC_R_SUCCESS; i++) {
911 addr = NULL;
912 fname = NULL;
913 result = isc_backtrace_getsymbolfromindex(i, &addr, &fname);
914 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
915 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
916 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_DEBUG(99),
917 "[%d] %p %s", i, addr, fname);
918 }
919 }
920}
921
922static void
923setup(void) {
924 isc_result_t result;
925 isc_resourcevalue_t old_openfiles;
926 ns_server_t *sctx;
927#ifdef HAVE_LIBSCF
928 char *instance = NULL;
929#endif
930
931 /*
932 * Get the user and group information before changing the root
933 * directory, so the administrator does not need to keep a copy
934 * of the user and group databases in the chroot'ed environment.
935 */
936 named_os_inituserinfo(named_g_username);
937
938 /*
939 * Initialize time conversion information
940 */
941 named_os_tzset();
942
943 named_os_opendevnull();
944
945#ifdef HAVE_LIBSCF
946 /* Check if named is under smf control, before chroot. */
947 result = named_smf_get_instance(&instance, 0, named_g_mctx);
948 /* We don't care about instance, just check if we got one. */
949 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS)
950 named_smf_got_instance = 1;
951 else
952 named_smf_got_instance = 0;
953 if (instance != NULL)
954 isc_mem_free(named_g_mctx, instance);
955#endif /* HAVE_LIBSCF */
956
957 /*
958 * Check for the number of cpu's before named_os_chroot().
959 */
960 named_g_cpus_detected = isc_os_ncpus();
961
962 named_os_chroot(named_g_chrootdir);
963
964 /*
965 * For operating systems which have a capability mechanism, now
966 * is the time to switch to minimal privs and change our user id.
967 * On traditional UNIX systems, this call will be a no-op, and we
968 * will change the user ID after reading the config file the first
969 * time. (We need to read the config file to know which possibly
970 * privileged ports to bind() to.)
971 */
972 named_os_minprivs();
973
974 result = named_log_init(named_g_username != NULL);
975 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
976 named_main_earlyfatal("named_log_init() failed: %s",
977 isc_result_totext(result));
978
979 /*
980 * Now is the time to daemonize (if we're not running in the
981 * foreground). We waited until now because we wanted to get
982 * a valid logging context setup. We cannot daemonize any later,
983 * because calling create_managers() will create threads, which
984 * would be lost after fork().
985 */
986 if (!named_g_foreground)
987 named_os_daemonize();
988
989 /*
990 * We call isc_app_start() here as some versions of FreeBSD's fork()
991 * destroys all the signal handling it sets up.
992 */
993 result = isc_app_start();
994 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
995 named_main_earlyfatal("isc_app_start() failed: %s",
996 isc_result_totext(result));
997
998 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
999 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
1000 "starting %s %s%s%s <id:%s>",
1001 named_g_product, named_g_version,
1002 *named_g_description ? " " : "", named_g_description,
1003 named_g_srcid);
1004
1005 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
1006 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
1007 "running on %s", named_os_uname());
1008
1009 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
1010 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
1011 "built with %s", named_g_configargs);
1012
1013 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
1014 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
1015 "running as: %s%s",
1016 program_name, saved_command_line);
1017#ifdef __clang__
1018 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
1019 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
1020 "compiled by CLANG %s", __VERSION__);
1021#else
1022#if defined(__ICC) || defined(__INTEL_COMPILER)
1023 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
1024 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
1025 "compiled by ICC %s", __VERSION__);
1026#else
1027#ifdef __GNUC__
1028 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
1029 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
1030 "compiled by GCC %s", __VERSION__);
1031#endif
1032#endif
1033#endif
1034#ifdef _MSC_VER
1035 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
1036 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
1037 "compiled by MSVC %d", _MSC_VER);
1038#endif
1039#ifdef __SUNPRO_C
1040 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
1041 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
1042 "compiled by Solaris Studio %x", __SUNPRO_C);
1043#endif
1044 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
1045 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
1046 "compiled with OpenSSL version: %s",
1047 OPENSSL_VERSION_TEXT);
1048#if !defined(LIBRESSL_VERSION_NUMBER) && \
1049 OPENSSL_VERSION_NUMBER >= 0x10100000L /* 1.1.0 or higher */
1050 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
1051 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
1052 "linked to OpenSSL version: %s",
1053 OpenSSL_version(OPENSSL_VERSION));
1054#else
1055 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
1056 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
1057 "linked to OpenSSL version: %s",
1058 SSLeay_version(SSLEAY_VERSION));
1059#endif /* OPENSSL_VERSION_NUMBER >= 0x10100000L */
1060#ifdef HAVE_LIBXML2
1061 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
1062 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
1063 "compiled with libxml2 version: %s",
1064 LIBXML_DOTTED_VERSION);
1065 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
1066 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
1067 "linked to libxml2 version: %s", xmlParserVersion);
1068#endif
1069#if defined(HAVE_JSON) && defined(JSON_C_VERSION)
1070 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
1071 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
1072 "compiled with libjson-c version: %s", JSON_C_VERSION);
1073 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
1074 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
1075 "linked to libjson-c version: %s", json_c_version());
1076#endif
1077#if defined(HAVE_ZLIB) && defined(ZLIB_VERSION)
1078 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
1079 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
1080 "compiled with zlib version: %s", ZLIB_VERSION);
1081 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
1082 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
1083 "linked to zlib version: %s", zlibVersion());
1084#endif
1085 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
1086 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
1087 "----------------------------------------------------");
1088 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
1089 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
1090 "BIND 9 is maintained by Internet Systems Consortium,");
1091 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
1092 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
1093 "Inc. (ISC), a non-profit 501(c)(3) public-benefit ");
1094 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
1095 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
1096 "corporation. Support and training for BIND 9 are ");
1097 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
1098 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
1099 "available at https://www.isc.org/support");
1100 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
1101 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
1102 "----------------------------------------------------");
1103
1104 dump_symboltable();
1105
1106 /*
1107 * Get the initial resource limits.
1108 */
1109#ifndef WIN32
1110 RUNTIME_CHECK(isc_resource_getlimit(isc_resource_stacksize,
1111 &named_g_initstacksize)
1112 == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
1113 RUNTIME_CHECK(isc_resource_getlimit(isc_resource_datasize,
1114 &named_g_initdatasize)
1115 == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
1116 RUNTIME_CHECK(isc_resource_getlimit(isc_resource_coresize,
1117 &named_g_initcoresize)
1118 == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
1119#endif
1120 RUNTIME_CHECK(isc_resource_getlimit(isc_resource_openfiles,
1121 &named_g_initopenfiles)
1122 == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
1123
1124 /*
1125 * System resources cannot effectively be tuned on some systems.
1126 * Raise the limit in such cases for safety.
1127 */
1128 old_openfiles = named_g_initopenfiles;
1129 named_os_adjustnofile();
1130 RUNTIME_CHECK(isc_resource_getlimit(isc_resource_openfiles,
1131 &named_g_initopenfiles)
1132 == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
1133 if (old_openfiles != named_g_initopenfiles) {
1134 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
1135 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN, ISC_LOG_NOTICE,
1136 "adjusted limit on open files from "
1137 "%" PRIu64 " to "
1138 "%" PRIu64,
1139 old_openfiles, named_g_initopenfiles);
1140 }
1141
1142 /*
1143 * If the named configuration filename is relative, prepend the current
1144 * directory's name before possibly changing to another directory.
1145 */
1146 if (! isc_file_isabsolute(named_g_conffile)) {
1147 result = isc_file_absolutepath(named_g_conffile,
1148 absolute_conffile,
1149 sizeof(absolute_conffile));
1150 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1151 named_main_earlyfatal("could not construct "
1152 "absolute path "
1153 "of configuration file: %s",
1154 isc_result_totext(result));
1155 named_g_conffile = absolute_conffile;
1156 }
1157
1158 /*
1159 * Record the server's startup time.
1160 */
1161 result = isc_time_now(&named_g_boottime);
1162 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1163 named_main_earlyfatal("isc_time_now() failed: %s",
1164 isc_result_totext(result));
1165
1166 result = create_managers();
1167 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1168 named_main_earlyfatal("create_managers() failed: %s",
1169 isc_result_totext(result));
1170
1171 named_builtin_init();
1172
1173 /*
1174 * Add calls to register sdb drivers here.
1175 */
1176 /* xxdb_init(); */
1177
1178#ifdef ISC_DLZ_DLOPEN
1179 /*
1180 * Register the DLZ "dlopen" driver.
1181 */
1182 result = dlz_dlopen_init(named_g_mctx);
1183 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1184 named_main_earlyfatal("dlz_dlopen_init() failed: %s",
1185 isc_result_totext(result));
1186#endif
1187
1188#if CONTRIB_DLZ
1189 /*
1190 * Register any other contributed DLZ drivers.
1191 */
1192 result = dlz_drivers_init();
1193 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1194 named_main_earlyfatal("dlz_drivers_init() failed: %s",
1195 isc_result_totext(result));
1196#endif
1197
1198 named_server_create(named_g_mctx, &named_g_server);
1199 sctx = named_g_server->sctx;
1200
1201 /*
1202 * Modify server context according to command line options
1203 */
1204 if (clienttest)
1205 ns_server_setoption(sctx, NS_SERVER_CLIENTTEST, true);
1206 if (disable4)
1207 ns_server_setoption(sctx, NS_SERVER_DISABLE4, true);
1208 if (disable6)
1209 ns_server_setoption(sctx, NS_SERVER_DISABLE6, true);
1210 if (dropedns)
1211 ns_server_setoption(sctx, NS_SERVER_DROPEDNS, true);
1212 if (ednsformerr) /* STD13 server */
1213 ns_server_setoption(sctx, NS_SERVER_EDNSFORMERR, true);
1214 if (ednsnotimp)
1215 ns_server_setoption(sctx, NS_SERVER_EDNSNOTIMP, true);
1216 if (ednsrefused)
1217 ns_server_setoption(sctx, NS_SERVER_EDNSREFUSED, true);
1218 if (fixedlocal)
1219 ns_server_setoption(sctx, NS_SERVER_FIXEDLOCAL, true);
1220 if (noaa)
1221 ns_server_setoption(sctx, NS_SERVER_NOAA, true);
1222 if (noedns)
1223 ns_server_setoption(sctx, NS_SERVER_NOEDNS, true);
1224 if (nonearest)
1225 ns_server_setoption(sctx, NS_SERVER_NONEAREST, true);
1226 if (nosoa)
1227 ns_server_setoption(sctx, NS_SERVER_NOSOA, true);
1228 if (notcp)
1229 ns_server_setoption(sctx, NS_SERVER_NOTCP, true);
1230 if (sigvalinsecs)
1231 ns_server_setoption(sctx, NS_SERVER_SIGVALINSECS, true);
1232
1233 named_g_server->sctx->delay = delay;
1234}
1235
1236static void
1237cleanup(void) {
1238 destroy_managers();
1239
1240 if (named_g_mapped != NULL)
1241 dns_acl_detach(&named_g_mapped);
1242
1243 named_server_destroy(&named_g_server);
1244
1245 named_builtin_deinit();
1246
1247 /*
1248 * Add calls to unregister sdb drivers here.
1249 */
1250 /* xxdb_clear(); */
1251
1252#ifdef CONTRIB_DLZ
1253 /*
1254 * Unregister contributed DLZ drivers.
1255 */
1256 dlz_drivers_clear();
1257#endif
1258#ifdef ISC_DLZ_DLOPEN
1259 /*
1260 * Unregister "dlopen" DLZ driver.
1261 */
1262 dlz_dlopen_clear();
1263#endif
1264
1265 dns_name_destroy();
1266
1267 isc_log_write(named_g_lctx, NAMED_LOGCATEGORY_GENERAL,
1268 NAMED_LOGMODULE_MAIN,
1269 ISC_LOG_NOTICE, "exiting");
1270 named_log_shutdown();
1271}
1272
1273static char *memstats = NULL;
1274
1275void
1276named_main_setmemstats(const char *filename) {
1277 /*
1278 * Caller has to ensure locking.
1279 */
1280
1281 if (memstats != NULL) {
1282 free(memstats);
1283 memstats = NULL;
1284 }
1285
1286 if (filename == NULL)
1287 return;
1288
1289 memstats = strdup(filename);
1290}
1291
1292#ifdef HAVE_LIBSCF
1293/*
1294 * Get FMRI for the named process.
1295 */
1296isc_result_t
1297named_smf_get_instance(char **ins_name, int debug, isc_mem_t *mctx) {
1298 scf_handle_t *h = NULL;
1299 int namelen;
1300 char *instance;
1301
1302 REQUIRE(ins_name != NULL && *ins_name == NULL);
1303
1304 if ((h = scf_handle_create(SCF_VERSION)) == NULL) {
1305 if (debug)
1306 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
1307 "scf_handle_create() failed: %s",
1308 scf_strerror(scf_error()));
1309 return (ISC_R_FAILURE);
1310 }
1311
1312 if (scf_handle_bind(h) == -1) {
1313 if (debug)
1314 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
1315 "scf_handle_bind() failed: %s",
1316 scf_strerror(scf_error()));
1317 scf_handle_destroy(h);
1318 return (ISC_R_FAILURE);
1319 }
1320
1321 if ((namelen = scf_myname(h, NULL, 0)) == -1) {
1322 if (debug)
1323 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
1324 "scf_myname() failed: %s",
1325 scf_strerror(scf_error()));
1326 scf_handle_destroy(h);
1327 return (ISC_R_FAILURE);
1328 }
1329
1330 if ((instance = isc_mem_allocate(mctx, namelen + 1)) == NULL) {
1331 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
1332 "named_smf_get_instance memory "
1333 "allocation failed: %s",
1334 isc_result_totext(ISC_R_NOMEMORY));
1335 scf_handle_destroy(h);
1336 return (ISC_R_FAILURE);
1337 }
1338
1339 if (scf_myname(h, instance, namelen + 1) == -1) {
1340 if (debug)
1341 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
1342 "scf_myname() failed: %s",
1343 scf_strerror(scf_error()));
1344 scf_handle_destroy(h);
1345 isc_mem_free(mctx, instance);
1346 return (ISC_R_FAILURE);
1347 }
1348
1349 scf_handle_destroy(h);
1350 *ins_name = instance;
1351 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
1352}
1353#endif /* HAVE_LIBSCF */
1354
1355/* main entry point, possibly hooked */
1356
1357int
1358main(int argc, char *argv[]) {
1359 isc_result_t result;
1360#ifdef HAVE_LIBSCF
1361 char *instance = NULL;
1362#endif
1363
1364#ifdef HAVE_GPERFTOOLS_PROFILER
1365 (void) ProfilerStart(NULL);
1366#endif
1367
1368 /*
1369 * Record version in core image.
1370 * strings named.core | grep "named version:"
1371 */
1372 strlcat(version,
1373#if defined(NO_VERSION_DATE) || !defined(__DATE__)
1374 "named version: BIND " VERSION " <" SRCID ">",
1375#else
1376 "named version: BIND " VERSION " <" SRCID "> (" __DATE__ ")",
1377#endif
1378 sizeof(version));
1379 result = isc_file_progname(*argv, program_name, sizeof(program_name));
1380 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1381 named_main_earlyfatal("program name too long");
1382
1383 isc_assertion_setcallback(assertion_failed);
1384 isc_error_setfatal(library_fatal_error);
1385 isc_error_setunexpected(library_unexpected_error);
1386
1387 named_os_init(program_name);
1388
1389 dns_result_register();
1390 dst_result_register();
1391 isccc_result_register();
1392#if USE_PKCS11
1393 pk11_result_register();
1394#endif
1395
1396#if !ISC_MEM_DEFAULTFILL
1397 /*
1398 * Update the default flags to remove ISC_MEMFLAG_FILL
1399 * before we parse the command line. If disabled here,
1400 * it can be turned back on with -M fill.
1401 */
1402 isc_mem_defaultflags &= ~ISC_MEMFLAG_FILL;
1403#endif
1404
1405 parse_command_line(argc, argv);
1406
1407 pfilter_open();
1408
1409#ifdef ENABLE_AFL
1410 if (named_g_fuzz_type != isc_fuzz_none) {
1411 named_fuzz_setup();
1412 }
1413
1414 if (named_g_fuzz_type == isc_fuzz_resolver) {
1415 dns_resolver_setfuzzing();
1416 } else if (named_g_fuzz_type == isc_fuzz_http) {
1417 isc_httpd_setfinishhook(named_fuzz_notify);
1418 }
1419#endif
1420 /*
1421 * Warn about common configuration error.
1422 */
1423 if (named_g_chrootdir != NULL) {
1424 int len = strlen(named_g_chrootdir);
1425 if (strncmp(named_g_chrootdir, named_g_conffile, len) == 0 &&
1426 (named_g_conffile[len] == '/' ||
1427 named_g_conffile[len] == '\\'))
1428 named_main_earlywarning("config filename (-c %s) "
1429 "contains chroot path (-t %s)",
1430 named_g_conffile,
1431 named_g_chrootdir);
1432 }
1433
1434 result = isc_mem_create(0, 0, &named_g_mctx);
1435 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
1436 named_main_earlyfatal("isc_mem_create() failed: %s",
1437 isc_result_totext(result));
1438 isc_mem_setname(named_g_mctx, "main", NULL);
1439
1440 setup();
1441
1442 /*
1443 * Start things running and then wait for a shutdown request
1444 * or reload.
1445 */
1446 do {
1447 result = isc_app_run();
1448
1449 if (result == ISC_R_RELOAD) {
1450 named_server_reloadwanted(named_g_server);
1451 } else if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
1452 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
1453 "isc_app_run(): %s",
1454 isc_result_totext(result));
1455 /*
1456 * Force exit.
1457 */
1458 result = ISC_R_SUCCESS;
1459 }
1460 } while (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS);
1461
1462#ifdef HAVE_LIBSCF
1463 if (named_smf_want_disable == 1) {
1464 result = named_smf_get_instance(&instance, 1, named_g_mctx);
1465 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS && instance != NULL) {
1466 if (smf_disable_instance(instance, 0) != 0)
1467 UNEXPECTED_ERROR(__FILE__, __LINE__,
1468 "smf_disable_instance() "
1469 "failed for %s : %s",
1470 instance,
1471 scf_strerror(scf_error()));
1472 }
1473 if (instance != NULL)
1474 isc_mem_free(named_g_mctx, instance);
1475 }
1476#endif /* HAVE_LIBSCF */
1477
1478 cleanup();
1479
1480 if (want_stats) {
1481 isc_mem_stats(named_g_mctx, stdout);
1482 isc_mutex_stats(stdout);
1483 }
1484
1485 if (named_g_memstatistics && memstats != NULL) {
1486 FILE *fp = NULL;
1487 result = isc_stdio_open(memstats, "w", &fp);
1488 if (result == ISC_R_SUCCESS) {
1489 isc_mem_stats(named_g_mctx, fp);
1490 isc_mutex_stats(fp);
1491 (void) isc_stdio_close(fp);
1492 }
1493 }
1494 isc_mem_destroy(&named_g_mctx);
1495 isc_mem_checkdestroyed(stderr);
1496
1497 named_main_setmemstats(NULL);
1498
1499 isc_app_finish();
1500
1501 named_os_closedevnull();
1502
1503 named_os_shutdown();
1504
1505#ifdef HAVE_GPERFTOOLS_PROFILER
1506 ProfilerStop();
1507#endif
1508
1509 return (0);
1510}
1511
